co.cask.cdap.api.procedure
Interface Procedure

All Superinterfaces:
ProgramLifecycle<ProcedureContext>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractProcedure
public interface Procedure
extends ProgramLifecycle<ProcedureContext>

This interface defines a Procedure.

Method Summary
 ProcedureSpecification configure()
          Configures this procedure providing a specification with more details about the procedure.
 void destroy()

          Initializes this Procedure at run-time.
 

Method Detail

configure

ProcedureSpecification configure()
Configures this procedure providing a specification with more details about the procedure.

To create a Procedure, one must implement this interface. This method will be invoked during deployment time and it returns a ProcedureSpecification to specify how to configure the given procedure. There are no guarantees around how many times this method will be called during deployment or runtime, hence, the configuration should be very simple and should not include initialization of resources.

Returns:
An instance of ProcedureSpecification
See Also:
ProcedureSpecification

initialize

void initialize(ProcedureContext context)
Initializes this Procedure at run-time.

This method is invoked only once during startup of Procedure on a per instance basis. This method can be be used to initialize any user related resources.

Specified by:
initialize in interface ProgramLifecycle<ProcedureContext>
Parameters:
context - procedure runtime context

destroy

void destroy()
Invoked after the Procedure has been stopped.

Upon stopping a Procedure, no more requests will be handled by this instance of Procedure. This method will be invoked after stopping incoming requests and closing ProcedureResponder

Specified by:
destroy in interface ProgramLifecycle<ProcedureContext>
